data.title: Cool piece of architecture
data.text:
We saw this house on a trolley tour of the city.  A private home and from what we learned owned by a very private 
architect but neat to drive by.  Certainly stands out in a very middle class mid century neighborhood.

data.title: Bart Prince--Spaceship House
data.text: I live in Albuquerque & this is a "must-see" attraction. Located near Nob Hill oon Monte Vista. Tip: you can see it on the ABQ Trolley Tour (take the tour).

data.title: I always called it the Hotdog House. . .
data.text: I didn't realize this had made the official attractions list, but that is great!  I've been taking people by this place for years, for photos and just general nosiness of a whimsical set of structures.  Park on the side street and take time to really notice the details--steps going up the tower, the see through nature of the building, the sculptures, and the cool house across the street, too.  A friend of mine stayed here once and said it wasn't the best laid out for living, he thought, but that's beside the point!  Easy to find, very unique.  took great pleasure in showing it to my engineering and architecture college kids.

data.title: Whimsical architecture
data.text: Fun to walk around. Imaginative and whimsical. Fun for all ages. Bring your imagination along, park your car and walk around to see not just that building but the ones around it

data.title: Quick, Easy, Free
data.text: Drove past Space ship house last night. It really is very unique. It was a fun, quick, and free activity. The neighbors house is very cool as well! We followed the directions off of tripadvisor and it was very easy to find. Def worth going to!

data.title: A quick fun stop
data.text: I would recommend taking a drive to see the spaceship house. It is cool to see the funky architecture. My teenage son loved it. The neighbor's house is cool too!

data.title: Worth the stop!
data.text: As we approach the house we heard metal grinding in the distance, it made us super curious thinking what type of other creations this talented person has!

data.title: Unbelievable!
data.text: I would never have known about the house if it had not been on the tour itinerary.  I have to confess I can't believe someone is living my choice in this house!  It is so eccentric and completely outrageous, it is worth seeing.  I really like the story about William Shatner stopping by and asking "beam me up Scotty" after the owner opened the door.

data.title: Bart Prince is my Hero
data.text:
Let's just say that Bart Prince is my hero.  

Not only did Bart graciously welcome my wife and I into his home, offer a tour, and explain his reasoning behind this awesome production; but he welcomed us into his world.  He shared models of properties, some built, some not yet, showed us photos of others, explained how he melded the owner's wishes with his artistic vision.  

It was a such a joy to get an in depth look at the mind behind such a masterful undertaking.

data.title: Free
data.text: Although you can't get inside; I rate with five "bubbles" this landmark because is free, doesn't take a lot of your time and is on the area of Nob Hill. Whether you believe in aliens or not don't miss this landmark if you are on the neighborhood.

data.title: Interesting architecture; be sure to check out the house next door too
data.text: Tucked away in the residential section of Nob Hill, Bart Prince's residence and studio are a must-see in Albuquerque. From the rounded windows on the second floor to the sculpture garden in the front yard, this is a sight to behold. The house next door, which is part of the complex, looks like it has a 1950's house trailer parked on top. Just a word of caution: Don't block the traffic.

data.title: Weird, but Totally awesome!
data.text: This is definitely something to see! An impressive house with impressive dinosaur statues. And it's free!

data.title: The aliens have landed
data.text:
Whether or not you've been to Roswell won't matter, this is definitely a must see. 
By the time you leave you'll be asking yourself if you really believe in aliens, or not. Hmm...

data.title: Check it out
data.text: This house is in a neat neighborhood. Not too far off the beaten path. Easy to drive by and park, take photos. Also called the Submarine house. This same architect has another house in the same block.

data.title: Case spaziali!!!
data.text: Assolutamente da non perdere per gli amanti dell'architettura, due edifici affiancati, uno più strano dell'altro. Uno sembra una grande astronave, la forma affusolata e particolare, l'altro più squadrato ma sempre interessante. Vale la pena un passaggio per vederli da fuori, sono abitate entrambe e quindi non visitabili all'interno.
